title: MarissaLopez
author: MarissaLopez
content: During my research about bitcoin,I was acquainted with the paraphrase BULL RUN, which from a wide range of meaning it's a state or period of time when the prices of stock's and shares rise above normal. Then Reflecting it back on bitcoin I learnt it is when crypto prices increase rapidly and significantly, so when the bitcoin prices increases what happens to the stock market?? Which drive me back to this question that "WHY IS BITCOIN ALWAYS IN A STATE OF BULL RUN"BTC

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: MarissaLopez on May 26, 2023, 09:33:19 AMTalking about halving events that occur every four years just as you said,what is it all about the events?can I be clarified with that.!The event that happens every 4 years is called "Bitcoin Halving." This could be seen as the process of reducing the total mining reward by half, controlling the rate at which new Bitcoin are produced (mined), and at the same time controlling the number of Bitcoin in circulation.The first halving happened in 2012, when the reward for miners was reduced from 50 Bitcoin as mining reward for each block to 25, which is a total reduction by half of the actual figure. This kind of reduction happens every 4 years; the last halving was around 2020, which brought down the block reward to 6 BTC+ per block (don't know the accurate figure), so next year 2024 is the expected next halving. This kind of event is usually among things that trigger a bull run.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Bitcoin operates in cycles, for a cycle to occur there has to be up periods and the down periods to complete the ring, this is the reflection of the Bitcoin market. We have periods of price spike where the chart is in the green zone and the general sentiment is very optimistic, this is the Bull run. We also have the down periods where the chart is mostly red and fear and panic is wide spread, this is the bear market.In economics both of this seasons complement each other, bear markets are needed tmfor consolidation and price stability as a constant rise is not feasible for any product. So, to answer your question; bitcoin is not always in a bull run.
